title: Product Recall
description: Michael tries to be proactive during a watermark crisis, but only makes the situation worse. Meanwhile, Angela has trouble being apologetic with customers, and Andy discovers a secret about his new girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Dressed as Dwight] It's kind of blurry. [puts on his glasses] That's better. [exhales] Question.  What kind of bear is best?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's a ridiculous question.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: False.  Black bear.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well that's debatable.  There are basically two schools of thought--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fact.  Bears eat beets.  Bears.  Beets.  Battlestar Galactica.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bears do not-- What is going on-- What are you doing?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Last week, I was in a drug store and I saw these glasses.  Uh, four dollars.  And it only cost me seven dollars to recreate the rest of the ensemble.  And that's a grand total of... [Jim calculates the total on his calculator-watch] eleven dollars.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what?  Imitation is the most sincere form of flattery, so I thank you. [Jim places a bobble-head on his desk]  Identity theft is not a joke, Jim!  Millions of families suffer every year!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: ... MICHAEL!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, that's funny.  MICHAEL!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Yes, I understand.  Can I transfer you to customer relations?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Absolutely.  I couldn't be more sorry about this.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [on phone] I know, I know.  We're all trying to get to the bottom of this.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [on phone] I am upset.  Don't I sound upset?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] It is disgusting.  I totally agree.  Well, we're going to recalling all of that paper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have a crisis.  Apparently, a disgruntled employee at the paper mill decided that it would be funny to put an obscene watermark on our 24 pound cream butter stock.  Five hundred boxes has gone out, with the image of a beloved cartoon duck, performing...  unspeakable acts upon a certain cartoon mouse that a lot of people like.  I've never been a fan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everybody in here.  STAT.  No time to lose.  Cri-Man-Squa.  F and C, doubletime.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cri-Man-Squa?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Crisis Management Squad.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: F and C, doubletime?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Front and Center. Twice as fast as you would normally go.  Any other questions?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: One more.  Why are you talking like that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To save time, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Actually I think you could make the argument that it wastes time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, she has a good point.  I mean, for example, with the last thing you said, by the time you explained it, it actually took up more time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? Bluh bluh bluh bluh bluh!  Forget it.  Where is Creed?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Creed.  Quality assurance.  Your job.  I really think you screwed the pooch on one, Creed.  Because of you, the entire company is in jeopardy.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Every week I'm supposed to take four hours and do a quality spot-check at the paper mill.  And of course the one year I blow it off, this happens.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have a lot of angry customers out there.  This puts us at threat level midnight.  Accounting, you are on customer service duty today.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's really not our job.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Midnight, Oscar!  Don't worry, Kelly will be training you first.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kelly's training us?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: This day is bananas. B-A-N-A-N-A-S.  This day is bananas!  B-A-N-A-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [getting a pill from the bottle] I don't have a headache.  I'm just preparing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim, big fire in your house.  Your client, Dunmore High-school, sent out their prom invitations on this paper.  Went home to all the kids.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I gotta call out on that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no, no.  Not good enough.  This is a keystone account.  I want you in the school.  In person.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to bring a partner.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'll go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, sweet cheeks.  We need someone who's actually made a sale.  Andy, you go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [English accent] William Dolittle at your service.  A.K.A., Will Do.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm definitely gonna go alone.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no.  I need two men on this.  That's what she said.  No time!  But she did.  NO TIME!  Guys, get on this.  Dwight, I want you to be in charge of the press conference.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!  You are entering the "No Spin Zone!"

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We're having a press conference?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Pam.  The press is just gonna find out by themselves.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not! [scoffs]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here's the thing.  When a company screws up, best thing to do is call a press conference.  Alert the media, and then you control the story.  Wait for them to find out, and the story controls you.  That's what happened to O.J.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have invited Barbara Allen, one of our oldest clients, to come in here, and meet with me, for a personal apology.  The press wants a story, I will give them a story.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, did the press ask for a story?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here is your headline. "Scranton Area Paper Company, Dunder Mifflin, apologizes to valued client.  Some companies still know how business is done."  Okay?  Battle stations everybody, let's go, go, go, go, go, go!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Yes, hello.  Creed Bratton, Quality Assurance, Dunder Mifflin Scranton.  I was supposed to meet with one of your floor managers last week for a quality inspection, and he or she wasn't there.  And I'm trying to remember who it was.  Mm-hmm.  Who wasn't there last week?  Debbie Brown.  And which day was that?  Wednesday, the eleventh.  Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: The only difference between me and a homeless man is this job.  I will do whatever it takes to survive.  Like I did... when I was a homeless man.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Look, I know the reason that you guys became accountants is because you're not good at interacting with people.  But guess what?  From now on, you guys are no longer losers!  So give yourselves a round of applause.  [Kelly and Kevin clap]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I wonder how many phone calls you're missing while you're teaching us to answer calls.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I know, right?  Probably a lot.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can you just tell us what we need to do so we can go?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: OK, Angela.  I love your enthusiasm.  All you need to know how to do is pick up the phone and say "Customer Service, this is Kelly!"  Except don't say "Kelly," say your own name.  Or if you're bored, you can just make up a name.  Like one time, I said I was Bridget Jones, [in an English accent] and I talked like this for the whole conversation!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh! Can I be [horrible Australian accent] Australian, mate?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [in accent] Absolutely!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [in accent] 'ello, mate!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [in accent] I like ice cream!  I need a boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [in accent] I like ice cream too, mate.  Alligators and dingo babies.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Beer me!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hand me that water.  I always say "Beer me."  Gets a laugh like a quarter of the time.  So how's what's-her-name?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know her name.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who, Karen?  Yeah, she's only one of my oldest friends.  [takes swig of water] Mmm.  How's the apartment hangin'?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's fine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nice.  Check out this sunshine, man.  Global warming, right?  Today was supposed to be really cold, I bet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What about music?  Do you have any music?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, yeah.  Should have said so.  [sings] Rha-dah-dah-dah!  Give me the beat, boys, and free my soul.  I wanna get lost in your rock and roll and drift away-he-hay.  Ruu-da-doo-da-doo, ba-dit-da-doo-da-dun, Give me the beat, boys, and free my little-ole-soul, I wa-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was thinkin' about more like a CD, or... a CD.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Your call, dude.  My girlfriend made an awesome mix.  Beer me that disc.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Lord, beer me strength.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So, Tuna.  When we get in there, let's do a really good job, okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Did that really need to be said?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well not everything a guy says needs to be said.  Sometimes it's just about the music of the conversation.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa!  What the-- Why is my girlfriend here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, is she that teacher in the white?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, she's a part-time frozen yogurt chef.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which one... is she?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: The one in the green hoodie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I wonder if she's, like, a... a guidance counselor, or something?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She's like, probably a tutor.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She probably a t-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sh--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, press conference in 45.  Dwight, make sure this place looks nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On it.  OK, Karen, Ryan, Pam, center stage.  Pam, run a comb through your hair.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: First rule in road-side beet sales: Put the most attractive beets on top.  The ones that make you pull the car over and go, "Wow, I need this beet right now."  Those are the money beets.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Chad Lite walks in the door] [to Office workers] Hey!  [snaps twice] Look sharp!  [to Chad Lite] Hey!  Uh, Hi.  Hello, Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Chad Lite
quotes.text: Hi, uh--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you must be uh, from the Washington Post.

quotes.speaker: Chad Lite
quotes.text: Scranton Times.  Chad Lite, "Lighter Side of Life."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And "Breaking Corporate News."

quotes.speaker: Chad Lite
quotes.text: And obits.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, dear God.  OK, here are your credentials.  You've been granted level three security clearance.

quotes.speaker: Chad Lite
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't get too excited, that's out of 20.  Right this way.  Regional Manager Michael Scott will be addressing the client in the press room shortly.  Have a seat, can I get you a beverage?

quotes.speaker: Chad Lite
quotes.text: Uh, yeah, I'd like uh, uh--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [shuts door on him] Great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, Andy.  You know what?  We don't have a lot of time, so we should probably...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jamie!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy-- Ohh...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Jamie
quotes.text: Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you a student here?

quotes.speaker: Jamie
quotes.text: Oh... yeah...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You never told me you were in high-school!

quotes.speaker: Jamie
quotes.text: This is weird.  I... gotta go to Spanish.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OH MY GOD!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I had no idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well... that's not gonna hold up in court.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Huh... We didn't do anything illegal.  Except knock over a mailbox with her friends.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [on phone] Sir, yes, you have a valid point.  I'm sorry.  No, I am so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [on phone] Really, Dixon City? ...Carbondale.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [on phone] Excuse me?  Well, I don't see how that's our fault.  And I've already told you, the official position of Dunder Mifflin is apologetic, so I don't know what you want from me. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: OK, first, I just wanna say that you are doing sooo good.  Look, you have so many good qualities, that the one that you might wanna work on is, apologizing?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: When I went over Wednesday, for the spot-check, I got a call from Debbie Brown, saying she has an emergency dentist appointment.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Emergency dentist appointment.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Now I'm told she told her manager she had the flu.  I'm a trusting guy, but uh, I just wish Debbie Brown had been there.  We would have caught this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, I'll be sure someone returns your call.  I'm so sorry.  Bye.

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: Hello, I'm looking for Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mrs. Allen is our most important client... because every client is our most important client.  Even though she's a pretty unimportant client, really.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And so, with the eyes of the nation upon us, I would like to say that Dunder Mifflin truly regrets this unfortunate incident.  And, as a gesture of gratitude, for your continued loyalty, Mrs. Allen, I would like to present you with this novelty check, for six months of free paper or 25 reams, whichever comes first.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [snaps picture with his camera phone] You look good in this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, let us consider this matter ended.

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: Well it isn't ended.  I'm... I'm very angry. I-- I could have lost business.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know you're angry.  And we are truly, truly sorry.

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: I don't accept your apology.  The watermark was obscene and horrifying.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, we are extremely sorry.

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: I don't accept.

quotes.speaker: School Official
quotes.text: I'll be with you in a moment.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who was that guy she was talking to?  At her locker.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not important.  Because you're not dating her.  Because it's a felony.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But who was that guy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Probably another high-school student.

quotes.speaker: School Official
quotes.text: The issue with the watermark is very serious.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: School Official
quotes.text: We teach our students that character counts.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And you should.

quotes.speaker: School Official
quotes.text: But--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [scoffs] Pfft.  You don't teach it well enough.  One of your students is a bitch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy... is having a real rough day today.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I want to take out an ad, in your yearbook.  A full page, two words--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "Good luck."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's not what I had in mind.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Ask where he's from.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [on phone] Where are you from?  Ohio?  That's nice.  So what do you want?  [to Kelly] He's upset about the watermark.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: OK, great.  Now tell him that it was an unfortunate error, and we're doing everything we can do to fix it, and that you're sorry.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [on phone] It was an unfortunate error.  We're fixing it.  And you already got your money back...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: And you're sorry.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: ...and the company has already apologized, so you can take that apology or not. [hangs up] [to Kelly] I think he had Tourette's or something!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We... are going to do everything humanly possible, to ensure that this never happens again.

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: Well, it-- it doesn't help, because it already happened to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The watermark... it's a one time thing.

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: I don't care!  It was disgusting.  Cartoon characters having sex?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: May I point out that the sex appeared to be consensual?  Both animals were smiling.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I grew up on a farm.  I have seen animals having sex in every position imaginable.  Goat on chicken.  Chicken on goat.  Couple of chickens doin' a goat, couple of pigs watching.  Whoever drew this got it exactly right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What... can I do, for you?

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: I, for starters, I think that you should resign.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well... [exhales] OK, well...  Um, wasn't really my fault.  The guys at the papermill--

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: You're the head--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The guys at the papermill-- No no no!

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: You're the head of the company!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm the head of the company?!

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: Yes, and that makes it your responsibility--

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I'm a regional manager--

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: And so you should lose your job!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No-- my-- OK, this is insane.  You can get out of here.  Get out!

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's insane.  We'll give this to somebody who will appreciate it.

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's non-transferable...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Doesn't matter.  Out please!

quotes.speaker: Barbara
quotes.text: I'm calling the Better Business Bureau.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well I'm calling the Ungrateful Bi-atch Hotline! [to Chad Lite] Did you get all that?

quotes.speaker: Chad Lite
quotes.text: Everything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We gotta do something. [exhales] This is spinning out of control, Pam.  This is just, not...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's just the Scranton Times...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, then Newsweek picks it up.  And then CNN does a story about it.  Then... YouTube gets a hold of it...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know what?  I really think the whole thing is just gonna blow over in like a week or two.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're right.  It will blow over.  But it's not... going to take... a week or two.  [pulls out a video camcorder from his desk] Do you know what this is for?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael likes me to run the camera when he makes his apology videos.  He says he needs a woman's touch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Dwight is spraying far too much hairspray into Michael's hair] OK, I think that's good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: "Hello.  I am Michael Scott, Regional Manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton.  By now you are probably sick of hearing about Dunder Mifflin and our embarrassing watermark boner.  Let me tell you something.  Something from the heart.  I am not leaving this office.  It will take a SWAT team, to remove me from this office, and maybe not even that."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh, you could never withstand a SWAT team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's how devoted I am to this job.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm just saying...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They would flank you.  Throw in a concussion grenade.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I understand that, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You would be on the ground, blind, deaf, dumb.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you think you're taking it a little... literally, Dwight?  And now we're wasting tape.  I'm gonna have to cut this all out.  Can you say cut?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cut.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I'll know where--

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cut.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm asking Pam to do it, please.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cut.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, ready?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin, what's four plus seven?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [thinks] Eleven.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, well you didn't know that when you filled out this payroll form.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, well at least I didn't suck at customer relations.  Oooh, yes.  Facial.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [laughs] Yes. [air high five]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You two are apes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I expect you to apologize for that, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm sorry... that you're both morons.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, but you still said "I'm sorry."

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I called you morons.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Still said it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Still said it, so... [Kevin and Oscar screw up an air high five]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Five, four, three.  "There is no way, I will resign.  It wouldn't be fair.  Not to the good workers I work with, not to my clients, and especially not to me.  Let's not forget who this whole resigning business is about, anyway.  If I could leave you with one thought, remember... it wasn't me.  They're trying to make me an escape goat.  If I am fired, I swear to God, that every single piece of copier paper in this town is going to have the F-word on it.  The F-word.  You have one day."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: One day for what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's... they always give an ultimatum.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, cut?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cut.  That was your best apology video ever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thought so too.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Got a farewell card for Debbie Brown.  I thought maybe you'd like to sign it.  Maybe throw a couple of bucks in there for her.  She's got some children.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I feel terrible about Debbie Brown.  She got fired because of Dwight.  So I thought I'd pass around a goodbye card, maybe everyone could put in a couple of bucks to help her through these difficult times.  Why do bad things always happen to the good people?  It's tragic.  Just tragic.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You want music?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't care.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on man, just give it a couple days.  I think you'll be all right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [singing the intro to The Lion King's "The Lion Sleeps Tonight"] A-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know what-- I don't--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Joins in with classic Andy falsetto] Oooo-oo-oooo-ooo-oo-oooo-oo-ooo-ooo a-wi-imbube!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oooo-oo-oooo-ooo-oo-oooo-oo-ooo-ooo a-wi-imbube!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh, a-wimowheh...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sweet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [walks in dressed as Jim] Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight.  You look really nice today.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [scoffs] Pssssh.  I look like an idiot. Hey Karen.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight, lookin' sharp.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, that's cause I'm... you're boyfriend, Jim Halpert.  Hey, Karen, wanna get t-together later and have sexual intercourse cause you're my girlfriend?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.text: I'm good.  Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Dwight imitates the "Jim face"] Look at that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm Jim Halpert. [more horrible "Jim faces"]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Spot on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah-luh-luh, a little comment.  Muh.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, I am so sorry, that is so messed up. Everyone here is so upset, you have no idea. And rest assured your voice has been heard. Okay, I'll be thinking about you all day. Customer service, this is Kelly. Oh my God, I am so sorry, that is so messed up. Everyone here is so upset, you have no idea. And rest assured your voice has been heard. Okay, I'll be thinking about you all day.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Customer service, this is Kelly. Oh my God, I am so sorry, that is so messed up. Everyone here is so upset, you have no idea. I'll be thinking about you all day. Customer service, this is Kelly. Oh my God, I am so sorry, that is so messed up. Everyone here is so upset, you have no idea. I'll be thinking about you all day. Customer service, this is Kelly. Oh my God, I am so sorry, that is so messed up. Everyone here is so upset, you have no idea. I'll be thinking about you all day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The key to a crisis is dealing with it right away. Like that aspirin company that sent out the poisoned aspirin in the regular aspirin bottles. If you don't act fast, you will lose customers.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello, CNN? I need to speak to your Scranton-area bureau chief? All right, then the bureau chief for the Greater Wilkes-Barre area? How about, ah, Lackawanna County. Okay, Northeastern Pennsylvania then. This is extremely urgent! No... you put your supervisor on the phone!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Customer service isn't like accounting. It's not just typing numbers into a calculator and then it tells you an answer.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We do a lot more than that.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Okay, or hand out checks, or whatever it is you do. Look, I know the reason that you guys became accountants is because you think that people don't like you. But guess what, from now on you guys are not losers! So give yourselves a round of applause.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I wonder how many phone calls you're missing while you're teaching us to answer phone calls.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: The annex rocks.  All you need to do is make sure that you make a connection with the customer. They just wanna know that you're sorry. Do that and you'll be fine. Make sense?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Mm-hm.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Okay, role-playing time!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Alright, I think I'm trained.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ooh, can I be a pirate?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [hums]

quotes.speaker: Chad Lite
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Chad Lite
quotes.text: Excuse me. You're Creed Bratton, guitar player for Grass Roots in the late 1960s.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I am indeed. How'd you know that?

quotes.speaker: Chad Lite
quotes.text: I wrote your obituary.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh, oh that's right! Good work. Thank you very much, sir [shakes hand].

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: About 10 years ago, for tax reasons, I faked my own death. I've been collecting benefits as my own widow ever since.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, my God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my God! Wow.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I had no idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Then you did nothing wrong. We should go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How could I not have realized?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She looks older.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, she does, doesn't she?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She acts older, too. She knows everything about European history, and photosynthesis, and she made me this lanyard with, like, a Fimo clay thing. She's a real Renaissance woman.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Or a high school girl. Let's go [mouths 'wow' to the camera].

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Chicken pot pie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's what I was eating, in the parking lot of a 7-Eleven for dinner. And I got out of the car to shake the crumbs off my shirt, and this smoking hot woman comes up and we strike up a conversation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. You don't have to tell me this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She lets me buy her and her friends some wine coolers for a dinner party she's going to.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You shouldn't be talking about that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I threw in some scratch tickets, 'cause generous guy, and next thing you know we're making out in the woods.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hypothetically. Hypothetically you were making out in the woods.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, we were really making out in the woods.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, can't help you now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I gotta go talk to her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. D-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: With dissatisfied clients, it doesn't matter what you did. All they wanna hear is that you're sorry. They're like women that way. And this client is a woman. So when I say I'm sorry, it will be twice as effective.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So we're good?

quotes.speaker: Barbara Allen
quotes.text: No, we're not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Barbara Allen
quotes.text: Well, okay. But I don't accept.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] Say you're sorry times infinity...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...'cause there's no comeback for that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. We are infinitely sorry.

quotes.speaker: Barbara Allen
quotes.text: I'm still furious.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You understand? You... you get this check.

quotes.speaker: Barbara Allen
quotes.text: Mmm.

quotes.speaker: Spanish Teacher
quotes.text: Can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. I'm Mr. Bernard Johnson, MD. I'd like to talk with Jamie about a certain heart condition. Diagnosis:

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't believe in apologies. When someone in the yakuza makes a mistake, they cut off a portion of their own pinky finger. And in that way, save face. And knowing the Japanese, they probably get an even better prosthetic finger. With a knife you can take out of it, or a screwdriver or a corkscrew.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why am I getting all of the bad ones?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Why can't you just say you're sorry and make them feel better?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm not gonna lie and say I'm sorry when the company didn't do anything wrong. That's immoral, and this is ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Would you, please? Please.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, you have to do what I say, okay? Because Michael put me in charge, even though you're old enough to be my mother.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What? Well what you say is stupid, and your job is pointless. And you're a slut and everyone thinks so.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, you're fired, okay? Go back to accounting, Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Gladly. I quit.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: If cartoon characters didn't have sex, then how would we get new cartoon characters? From the sex! [giggles]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The customer is always right. Mrs. Allen was our customer. She was wrong. Is that a contradiction? No. Because she's not our customer anymore.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael likes me to run the camera when he makes his apology videos. My favorite is the one for his mother.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Mom. Happy birthday, belatedly. Sorry I forgot. I had put it on my calendar and Pam threw that out.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: My personal favorite is the one he made for his condo association.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And without denying the seriousness of the situation, I would just like to remind you that in much of the Netherlands, swimming naked is the norm. So in Norway, you'd be the weirdos.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, Andy, we need to go. Seriously.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dude, there she is. Don't look, don't look. She's sitting with Denise. How am I supposed to do this? Denise hates me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don't do it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What is your problem, man? Can't you support a bro? That's why you don't have any friends, Tuna. I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I just, I need...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: ...your help. I love her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. I lo- I love her. Is this what love is?  This, like, horrible feeling in my stomach?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, that's your conscience. Listen to it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Look, okay, just be my wingman. Beer me five minutes. Talk to Denise. She's really into White Russians and whippets.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jamie, can I talk to you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Jamie
quotes.text: Yeah. I only have a minute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sits down next to Denise] So, high school.

quotes.speaker: Denise
quotes.text: Do you have a cigarette?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, I don't smoke. Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Denise
quotes.text: There's nothing to do in this town.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You should take up a musical instrument.

quotes.speaker: Denise
quotes.text: Yeah, I should take up that. Jamie?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, uh, does Mr. Nortman still teach here? He's a jerk, right?

quotes.speaker: Denise
quotes.text: He's dead. Hey, do you have any weed?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, nope. What else? What else? You watch The Hills? What is Heidi thinking?

quotes.speaker: Denise
quotes.text: How old are you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How old do you think I am?

quotes.speaker: Denise
quotes.text: Forty?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [shakes head]

quotes.speaker: Denise
quotes.text: Are you someone's dad here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not that I know of.

quotes.speaker: Denise
quotes.text: Ew. What kind of car do you have?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I drive a Saab station wagon.

quotes.speaker: Denise
quotes.text: My dad just gave me his old Lexus.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really? Way to earn it. Hey, Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very well [hangs up phone]. I just got a call from Debbie Brown over at the mill. She claims innocence and is willing to come over here and defend herself.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: No time. Dwight, I love Debbie Brown. She's a close personal friend. But quality is my life. This company has a reputation to uphold. As much as it pains me, someone has to be held accountable.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're right. Mercy is for girl-babies. Time to put this dog down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are we ready?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Final touch-ups.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Am I shiny?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. We good? Okay, that's enough Aqua Net.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't know...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [clears throat] Stop it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [coughs]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hey, Angela. I'm sorry that I said you were old enough to be my mother. I don't know why I said that. I think I might be hypoglycemic or something, but still, it's no excuse. So, I'm very sorry.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh. Thank you, Kelly [long pause]. And I wish I hadn't called you stupid.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Do you think I'm a slut?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, but some of your outfits are not appr-

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Apology accepted! [hugs Angela]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I didn't apologize.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: We're like best friends now!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: We're not.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'll text you!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Don't!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Bye, Angela!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That is all I was looking for today. She got something out of my training session. I mean, she will never work in customer relations. Oh, my God, no. Never. But maybe she'll be less of a grump.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kelly's not so bad. She really taught me something today [rolls eyes].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have literally apologized an infinite number of times on this, and there are still calls for me to resign. Calls from an annoying woman, and possibly even the media alike. Well let me tell you something, something from the heart. I will not resign. I need this job. My mortgage is hundreds of dollars a month. With this job, I can barely cover that. I have a company car, but I still have to pay for gas, and gas prices are high. And I have no savings whatsoever. And it wasn't even me. It's so not fair that they want me to resign.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...to the fullest extent of the law [hangs up phone]. Listen up, everyone! I just got off the phone with the mill.  Final responsibility for Watermark-gate has been assigned. Floor manager Debbie Brown has officially been terminated. Lets give a big hand to Creed Bratton, without whose earnest and diligent sleuthing this scandal might never have been resolved [claps].

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Just doing my job, guys.
